The Venerable SubhÅ«ti, knowing the thoughts of the assembly of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, the great hearers, devas, nÄgas, yaká¹£as, humans, and non-humans, then said to the Venerable ÅšÄriputra:
You should know that the Dharma teachings spoken by the disciples of the Buddhas are all by the majestic power of the Buddha.
Why is it so?
ÅšÄriputra!

When the Buddhas proclaim the Dharma for others, they diligently cultivate and study in accordance with the Buddha's teachings, and are able to realize the true nature of dharmas. Therefore, what they proclaim for others is all in accord with the nature of dharmas and is not in contradiction. Thus, the words of the Buddha are like the transmission of light from a lamp.
ÅšÄriputra!

I will rely on the majestic power and protection of the Buddha to proclaim the Dharma that accords with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ for the assembly of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, and to instruct and teach the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, enabling them to cultivate and study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ to the utmost, not by the power of my own wisdom and eloquence.

The teachings associated with the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are not the domain of Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.
At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
As instructed by the Buddha:

'You should use your eloquence to expound the teachings associated with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ for the assembly of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, instruct and teach the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, enabling them to cultivate and study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ to the utmost.'

Herein, what is called a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
What is the dharma called prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ?
World-Honored One!

I do not see any dharma that can be called a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, nor do I see any dharma that can be called prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ. I also do not see the existence of these two names. How can I cause the assembly of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas to proclaim the Dharma that accords with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ for the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, and to instruct and teach the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, causing them to cultivate and study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ to the utmost?
The Buddha said:
SubhÅ«ti!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is merely a name, called a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. PrajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is also merely a name, called prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ. These two names are also merely names.
SubhÅ«ti!

These three names are neither produced nor extinguished. They only have conceptual thoughts, conventional thoughts, and verbal expressions. Such provisional names are neither inside, outside, nor in between, because they cannot be apprehended.
SubhÅ«ti should know!

It is just like how 'self' is merely a provisional designation. Such a nominal designation is neither produced nor extinguished. There is only conceptualization, thought, and verbal expression designating it as a 'self.'

In the same way, 'sentient being,' 'life,' 'nourishment,' 'man,' 'person,' 'mind-born,' 'youth,' 'doer,' 'cause of doing,' 'arouser,' 'cause of arousing,' 'experiencer,' 'cause of experiencing,' 'knower,' and 'seer' are also merely provisional designations. Such nominal designations are neither produced nor extinguished. There is only conceptualization, thought, and verbal expression designating them as 'sentient beings' up to 'seers.'
In this way, all are merely provisional designations. These provisional designations are neither internal, nor external, nor in between. Because they cannot be apprehended.
Thus, SubhÅ«ti!

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, and these two names are all provisional dharmas, such provisional dharmas are neither produced nor extinguished, and there is only conceptualization, verbalization, and designation, calling them bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, calling them prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and these two names.
These three kinds are only provisional names. These provisional names are neither internal, nor external, nor in between, because they cannot be apprehended.

Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!ğŸ”½It is just like form, which is only a provisional dharma. Such a dharma-provision is neither produced nor extinguished, and there is only conceptualization, verbalization, and designation, calling it form;

In the same way, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are also only provisional dharmas. Such a dharma-provision is neither produced nor extinguished, and there is only conceptualization, verbalization, and designation, calling them feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.
In this way, all are merely provisional names. These provisional names are neither internal, nor external, nor in between, because they cannot be apprehended.

If the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the perfection of wisdom, and these two names are all provisional dharmas, these provisional dharmas are neither produced nor extinguished, and there is only conceptualization, conventional designation, and verbal expression, referring to the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, referring to the perfection of wisdom, and referring to these two names.
These three kinds are merely provisional names. These provisional names are neither internal, nor external, nor in between, because they cannot be apprehended.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

For example, the eye sense field is merely a provisional dharma. Such a dharma-provisional is neither produced nor extinguished, and there is only conceptualization, conventional designation, and verbal expression, referring to the eye sense field;

The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are also merely provisional phenomena. Such provisional phenomena are neither born nor extinguished. There is only conceptualization, designation, and verbal expression calling them the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
All of these are merely provisional names. These provisional names are neither internal, nor external, nor in between, because they cannot be apprehended.

If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, and these two names are all provisional phenomena, such provisional phenomena are neither born nor extinguished. There is only conceptualization, designation, and verbal expression calling them a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, and these two names.

Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
Just as the form realm is merely a nominal dharma, so is this dharma-name unborn and unceasing, only conceptualization, designation, and verbal expression call it the form realm;

In the same way, the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms are also merely nominal dharmas, and this dharma-name is unborn and unceasing, only conceptualization, designation, and verbal expression call them the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms.
In this way, all are merely nominal, and these nominal dharmas are neither internal, nor external, nor in between, because they cannot be apprehended.

If the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the perfection of wisdom, and these two names are all nominal dharmas, then these nominal dharmas are unborn and unceasing, only conceptualization, designation, and verbal expression call them the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the perfection of wisdom, and these two names.
These three kinds are merely provisional names. These provisional names are not within, not without, and not in between, because they cannot be apprehended.

It is just like the eye-element, which is merely a provisional dharma. Such a dharma-provision is neither born nor extinguished, but only conceptual thoughts and mental images, and verbal expressions designate it as the eye-element;

In the same way, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind elements are also merely provisional dharmas. Such dharma-provisions are neither born nor extinguished, but only conceptual thoughts and mental images, and verbal expressions designate them as the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind elements.

These three kinds are only provisional names. These provisional names are neither internal, nor external, nor in between, because they cannot be apprehended.

For example, the eye-consciousness element is merely a provisional dharma. Such a dharma-provisional is neither produced nor extinguished, and there is only conceptualization, conventional designation, and verbal expression, referring to the eye-consciousness element;

The same applies to the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness elements. These elements are merely imputed phenomena. Such imputed phenomena do not arise or cease. There is only conceptualization, thought, and verbal expression calling them the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness elements.

It is just like eye contact, which is merely a nominal dharma. Such a nominal dharma is neither produced nor extinguished, but only conceptualized and verbally designated as eye contact.

In the same way, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact are also merely nominal dharmas. Such nominal dharmas are neither produced nor extinguished, but only conceptualized and verbally designated as ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact.
